properties.media:imagetext:
YOUR WARDROBE
Planning is the key to a successful and practical travel
wardrobe. Plan your wardrobe around one of the basic
colors —"accessories" with belts, scarves, costume
jewelry of different hues-—avoid fussy clothes. Frilly
things wrinkle badly! Avoid the too-full skirt or the
uncomfortable "slim-jim" skirt. Comfortable shoes are
a "must". It's better to break them in before you leave.
Your wardrobe will be determined largely by the cli-
mate of the countries you plan to visit. Wools for the
colder countries; cottons for the warmer climes. The
new miracle fabrics hold their creases and shed
wrinkles. A chic American woman builds her wardrobe
on simplicity and is always well groomed. She does not
overload with extras and non-essentials. For warm cli-
mates and longer stays, add silk, nylon or orlon dresses
and blouses. They are very light and perfect travelers.
With limitations on space and weight, the easy-wash-
ing, fast-drying materials are the woman air traveler's
dream come true. Your wardrobe should also include
a light raincoat, preferably of the crushable plastic
type. It is desirable to carry a large handbag or purse
with many compartments.
Following are some suggestions for your wardrobe-
with plenty of luggage weight allowance left over to
carry home your "loot" without the worry of additional
baggage charges. As you may know, you are allowed
44 Ibs. on economy-class flights and 66 Ibs. on first-
class. You will have to pay excess charges on any
weight over these limits. Of course, you can send some
of your purchases home at reasonable rates by
SABENA air cargo service.
The following may be taken aboard the airplane with-
out being included in your baggage weight:
Lady's handbag or pocketbook, overcoat or wrap.
An umbrella, a small camera and a pair of binoc-
ulars. A reasonable amount of reading matter.
Infant's carrying basket and infant's food
for consumption en route.
The following items are a part of
your weighable luggage (44 Ibs.
on tourist-class and 66 Ibs. on
first-class): Overnight bags,
briefcases, large cam-
eras, typewriters, per-
sonal radios, van-
ity cases and all
other miscel-
laneous
items.
SUGGESTIONS FOR LADIES:
BASIC AIR TRAVEL WARDROBE
1 air luggage piece (as light and
durable as possible).
1 overnight bag.
1 cotton dress.
1 wool dress.
2 silk or rayon dresses.
3 sets of bras and panties
(nylon or dacron) ..
3 slips (nylon or dacron)
1 nylon robe..
2 nylon girdles.
12 pairs of stockings (including
extra sheer for evening)
2 nylon or dacron blouses.
1 sweater set..
1 pair of walking shoes.
1 pair of pumps.
1 pair of evening shoes.
1 small hat or headdress for
evening wear.
1 dressy suit..
1 swim suit and cap.
1 woolen stole..
Jewelry, belts, scarves and other
accessories
Cosmetics, hair brush, hair
accessories, tissues, etc...........
Small first aid kit..
Total weight ..
6 Ibs.

This allows you 8 Ibs. for purchases abroad, to come
within the free baggage allowance for tourist
flights of 44 Ibs. You can apply the same basic
wardrobe suggestions to your first class al-
lowance of 66 Ibs. by merely adding
more dresses, another suit and more
jewelry and accessories, if you
feel that way about it.
*This is the weight of the
SABENA overnight bag,
presented to first
